content.text: is designed to process gas meter billing adjustments for a utility company. It sequentially processes records from a temporary table,
, and updates or inserts records into the

tables. The procedure handles various scenarios, including updating existing records and inserting new ones, based on the presence or absence of certain records. It also updates the status of meters in the

The procedure is complex due to its extensive use of conditional logic, multiple table joins, and the handling of various scenarios for updating and inserting records. It involves multiple steps and checks to ensure data integrity and correct processing of billing adjustments.
: This parameter is used to track the user who is executing the procedure, ensuring that changes are authenticated and traceable.
: This output parameter is intended to return the status of the procedure execution, indicating success or failure.
: The procedure begins by declaring several local variables to track the state and results of various operations.
: It selects the current billing period and related identifiers from the
: It checks if there are existing meter billing adjustments for the current billing period and utility company.
: If no existing adjustments are found, it inserts new records into the
: If existing records are found, it updates the
: If no corresponding records exist in the
: Finally, it updates the status of meters in the
: Although not explicitly using a cursor, the procedure processes data row by row, which can be inefficient for large datasets.
: The procedure involves multiple joins, which can be resource-intensive and slow down performance, especially if indexes are not properly utilized.
: The extensive use of conditional logic can lead to complex execution paths, affecting performance.
: The procedure may face concurrency issues if multiple instances are run simultaneously, potentially leading to data inconsistencies.
: There is no explicit error handling within the procedure, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and incomplete transactions.
: The procedure's complexity and reliance on sequential processing may not scale well with large volumes of data.
: The procedure assumes that data in the temporary table is accurate and complete, which may not always be the case, leading to incorrect billing adjustments.
: While the procedure updates records, it relies on triggers for auditing, which may not capture all necessary changes if triggers are disabled or misconfigured.

CREATE PROCEDURE [Gas].[usp_ProcessGasMeterBilling](@AuthenticatedUserID int, @StatusCode int output)
AS
--**************************************************************************************
--* Name:         
--*
--* Description:  Process the NYPA Meter billing adjustments sequentially.
--* 		  
--* 		  The Meter billing adjustments are in the UploadNYPAMeterBillingTemporary table. 
--* 		  The information is processed by creating a cursor to sequentially process
--* 		  the data one row at a time.  The usp_ProcessMeterBillingEachCanceRebill
--* 		  stored procedure will handle all of the pssoible cases in the transaction
--* 		  processing. The most notable is when an original billing period record does 
--* 		  exist the system will create one on behalf of the revision. When the records
--* 		  exist they will update the various records.
--*               
--* Exec:       		usp_ProcessMeterBillingRebills
--*
--* Parameter(s):         
--*                             @UtiltiyCompanySeqid int,
--*                             @CurrentBillingPeriod varchar(6),
--*				 @StatusCode int output)
--*
--* Database:     OEC
--*
--* Return:	    0 Success
--*                   9 Failure
--*
--* AUTHOR:       Peter Heller (PAH)
--* Created On:   10/26/2005
--**************************************************************************************
--* Date         Tech Description of Change
--* ---------- ----  -------------------------------------------------------------
--* 10/26/2005 PAH  First Version  
--* 03/27/2006 PAH  Revised to 
--* 10/30/2006 PAH  Revised to 
--***************************************************************************************
Begin 
--************************************************************************************** 
--Declare Variables                                            
--**************************************************************************************
--
declare @RC int
--
declare @NumberOfAdjustmentsAdded int
declare @CurrentBillingPeriod varchar(8)
declare @InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid int 
declare @UtilityCompanySeqid int
--
declare @HasMeterBillingAdjustmentGasBeenProcessed int
declare @HasMeterBillingGasBeenProcessed int
declare @HasMeterBillingBeenProcessed int
declare @HasMeterBillingInsertsBeenProcessed int
--
declare @BillingMeterBillingGasUpdateTransactionCount int
declare @BillingMeterBillingUpdateTransactionCount int 
--
declare @BillingMeterBillingGasInsertTransactionCount int
declare @BillingMeterBillingInsertTransactionCount int 
--
--**************************************************************************************  
--SET DEFAULTS                                                  
--**************************************************************************************
--
--************************************************************************************** 
--	Main Processing
--**************************************************************************************
--
--
SELECT TOP (1) @CurrentBillingPeriod = BillingPeriod, @InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid=InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid, @UtilityCompanySeqid=UtilityCompanySeqid
FROM Gas.UploadAccountBillingAdjustmentGas
--
SELECT  @HasMeterBillingAdjustmentGasBeenProcessed = COUNT(*)
FROM 
		Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas INNER JOIN
		Billing.Account ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid AND 
		Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider AND 
		Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber
where 
		Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.LastPeriodModified  = @CurrentBillingPeriod and
		Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = @UtilityCompanySeqid and 
		Billing.Account.CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup = @InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid
--
	if (@HasMeterBillingAdjustmentGasBeenProcessed = 0)
	BEGIN
		--
		INSERT INTO Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas
			  ( UploadMeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid, FacilityName, ServiceAddress, UtilityCompanySeqid, AccountSeqid, 
			  MeterSeqid, AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid, MeterBillingSeqid, MeterBillingGasSeqid, OriginalAccountNumber, OriginalMeterNumber, 
			  LastPeriodModified, BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, FirstCancelPeriod, NumberOfTransactions, NumberOfRebillTransactions, 
			  NumberOfCancelTransactions, BillingAction, MeterBillingStatus, MeterBillingPreviousStatus, MeterBillingStatusPeriod, PriorRevisedBilledCCF, 
			  RevisedBilledCCF, CanceledBilledCCF, PriorRevisedBilledTherms, RevisedBilledTherms, CanceledBilledTherms, InitialCancelFromDate, 
			  CurrentBillingToDate, GasRateCode, FromDate, ToDate, FromReadingDate, ToReadingDate, MeterFromReading, MeterToReading, Ccf, Therms, 
			  ThermsFactor, MeterConstant, TotalBillingDaysRebilled, NumberOfBillingPeriods, BillingDays, BillingDate, ReadingCode, NumberOfDials, MeterType, 
			  ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, ProcessEffectiveDate, CancelReadingCode, CancelFromDate, CancelToDate, CancelMeterFromReading, 
			  CancelMeterToReading, CancelCcf, CancelTherms, CancelThermsFactor, CancelMeterConstant, InitialPostingDate, DerivedFromSpannedBill, 
			  SpannedBillingPeriodRevision, SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod, SpannedCCF, SpannedThermFactor, SpannedTherm, SpannedMonthlyPercentage, 
			  SpannedTotalPercentage, EstimatedOrActualBilling, MeterReset, AuthenticatedUserID, Notes, DateAdded, LastUpdate,
			  BillCreationDate,EnergySource,BillingCycle,SalesType,IsTimeOfDayAccount,MeterDials,GasCorrectionFactor)

		SELECT    
				UploadMeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid, FacilityName, ServiceAddress, UtilityCompanySeqid, AccountSeqid, MeterSeqid, 
				AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid, MeterBillingSeqid, MeterBillingGasSeqid, OriginalAccountNumber, OriginalMeterNumber, BillingPeriod, --LastPeriodModified, 
				BillingPeriod, BillingPeriodRevision, FirstCancelPeriod, NumberOfTransactions, NumberOfRebillTransactions, NumberOfCancelTransactions, 
				BillingAction, MeterBillingStatus, MeterBillingPreviousStatus, MeterBillingStatusPeriod, PriorRevisedBilledCCF, RevisedBilledCCF, 
				CanceledBilledCCF, PriorRevisedBilledTherms, RevisedBilledTherms, CanceledBilledTherms, InitialCancelFromDate, CurrentBillingToDate, 
				GasRateCode, FromDate, ToDate, FromReadingDate, ToReadingDate, MeterFromReading, MeterToReading, Ccf, Therms, ThermsFactor, 
				MeterConstant, TotalBillingDaysRebilled, NumberOfBillingPeriods, BillingDays, BillingDate, ReadingCode, NumberOfDials, MeterType, 
				ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, ProcessEffectiveDate, CancelReadingCode, CancelFromDate, CancelToDate, CancelMeterFromReading, 
				CancelMeterToReading, CancelCcf, CancelTherms, CancelThermsFactor, CancelMeterConstant, InitialPostingDate, DerivedFromSpannedBill, 
				SpannedBillingPeriodRevision, SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod, SpannedCCF, SpannedThermFactor, SpannedTherm, SpannedMonthlyPercentage, 
				SpannedTotalPercentage, EstimatedOrActualBilling, MeterReset, AuthenticatedUserID, Notes, DateAdded, LastUpdate,
				BillCreationDate,EnergySource,BillingCycle,SalesType,IsTimeOfDayAccount,MeterDials,GasCorrectionFactor
		FROM Gas.UploadMeterBillingAdjustmentGas
	end
	--
	--
	-- Update the adjustments first since the Billing.AccountBillingAdjustmentGas for the current period
	-- has indetified all of the adjustments that exist in EC3.  The Billing.MeterBilling MeterBillingSeqid
	-- is not null and the Billing.MeterBillingGas MeterBillingGasSeqid is not null.
	-- 
	-- The key to this update is the setting of the LastUpdate to a null value so the audit trigger preserves
	-- the prior state of the row before the Billing.AccountBilling or Billing.AccountBillingGas are updated
	-- with the adjusted values.
	--
--	select @HasMeterBillingGasBeenProcessed = count(*) from Billing.MeterBillingGas  where BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod and @UtilityCompanySeqid=UtilityCompanySeqid
--	select @HasMeterBillingBeenProcessed = count(*) from Billing.MeterBilling  
--	where BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod and @UtilityCompanySeqid=AccountUtilityCompanySeqid
--
	declare @HasMeterBillingUpdatedBeenProcessed int
--
	SELECT @HasMeterBillingUpdatedBeenProcessed = COUNT(*)
	FROM 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas INNER JOIN
			Billing.Account ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber LEFT JOIN
			Billing.MeterBilling ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingSeqid = Billing.MeterBilling.MeterBillingSeqid AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.LastPeriodModified = Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified
	WHERE 
			(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingSeqid is not null) and
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.LastPeriodModified  = @CurrentBillingPeriod and
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = @UtilityCompanySeqid and 
			Billing.Account.CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup = @InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid

	--
	-- if this occurs "isnull(@HasMeterBillingInsertsBeenProcessed,1)"  then set the value to 1 and do not process
	--
if (isnull(@HasMeterBillingUpdatedBeenProcessed,0) <> 0)
   BEGIN
		--
		--	Update the existing Billing.MeterBilling adjustments prior to inserting the adjustments
		--
		UPDATE    Billing.MeterBilling
		SET              
				IsDerived =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.DerivedFromSpannedBill, 
				UploadFileSeqid =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UploadMeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid, 
				LastPeriodModified =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.LastPeriodModified, 
				MeterBillingStatus =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingStatus, 
				PreviousMeterBillingStatus =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingPreviousStatus,
				MeterBillingStatusCodePeriod =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingStatusPeriod, 
				EstimatedReading =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.EstimatedOrActualBilling,
				ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading =[Common].[CalculateConsecutiveNumberOfEstimatedReadings]
					(	Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber, 
						Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber, 
						Billing.MeterBilling.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, 
						Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision,
						Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingCycle,
						Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.EstimatedOrActualBilling
					),
				BillingPeriodDays =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingDays, 
				FromDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.FromDate, 
				ToDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.ToDate, 
				ToReadingDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.ToReadingDate, 
				FromReadingDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.FromReadingDate, 
				Consumption =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.RevisedBilledTherms,
				AdjustmentRecordSeqid =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid, 
				AuthenticatedUserID =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.AuthenticatedUserID, 
				Notes =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.Notes, 
				LastUpdate = getdate(),
				FireAuditTrigger = 'Y'
		FROM 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas INNER JOIN
				Billing.MeterBilling ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.MeterBilling.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriod AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision
		WHERE   
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingSeqid IS NOT NULL) AND 
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod)
		--
		set @BillingMeterBillingUpdateTransactionCount = @@rowcount
		--
		--	Update the existing Billing.MeterBillingGas adjustments prior to inserting the adjustments
		--
		--	Note:  The legacy GasCorrectionFactor will never be adjusted.
		--
		UPDATE    Billing.MeterBillingGas
		SET             
				MeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid, 
				MeterBillingRowState =2, 
				FromDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.FromDate, 
				ToDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.ToDate, 
				FromReadingDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.FromReadingDate, 
				ToReadingDate =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.ToReadingDate, 
				ReadingCode =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.ReadingCode, 
				MeterReset =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterReset, 
				MeterFromReading =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterFromReading, 
				MeterToReading =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterToReading, 
				MeterConstant =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterConstant, 
				Ccf =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.RevisedBilledCCF, 
				ThermsFactor =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.ThermsFactor, 
				Therms =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.RevisedBilledTherms, 
				AuthenticatedUserID =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.AuthenticatedUserID, 
				Notes =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.Notes, 
				LastPeriodModified =Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.LastPeriodModified, 
				LastUpdate = getdate(),
				FireAuditTrigger = 'Y'
		FROM 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas INNER JOIN
				Billing.MeterBillingGas ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.MeterBillingGas.UtilityCompanySeqid AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBillingGas.BillingPeriod AND 
				Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBillingGas.BillingPeriodRevision
		WHERE 
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingSeqid IS NOT NULL) AND 
				(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod)
		set @BillingMeterBillingGasUpdateTransactionCount = @@rowcount
   end
	--
	declare @HasMeterBillingInsertedBeenProcessed int
	--
--	select @HasMeterBillingInsertedBeenProcessed = count(*) from Billing.MeterBilling  
--	where BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod and @UtilityCompanySeqid=AccountUtilityCompanySeqid
	--
	SELECT  @HasMeterBillingInsertedBeenProcessed = COUNT(*)
	FROM 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas INNER JOIN
			Billing.Account ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.AccountSeqid = Billing.Account.AccountSeqid AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber LEFT JOIN
			Billing.MeterBilling ON Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingSeqid = Billing.MeterBilling.MeterBillingSeqid AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.LastPeriodModified = Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified
	WHERE 
			(Billing.MeterBilling.MeterBillingSeqid is null) and
			(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.MeterBillingSeqid is null) and
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.LastPeriodModified  = @CurrentBillingPeriod and
			Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = @UtilityCompanySeqid and 
			Billing.Account.CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup = @InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid
	--
	-- if this occurs in either case "isnull(@HasMeterBillingGasBeenProcessed,1)" or "isnull(@HasMeterBillingBeenProcessed" then set the value to 1 and not process
	--
if (isnull(@HasMeterBillingInsertedBeenProcessed,0) <> 0)
   BEGIN
		declare @maxMeterBillingSeqid int
		declare @maxMeterBillingGasSeqid int
		--
		select @maxMeterBillingSeqid = max(MeterBillingSeqid) from Billing.MeterBilling	
		select @maxMeterBillingGasSeqid = max(MeterBillingGasSeqid) from Billing.MeterBillingGas	
		--
		INSERT INTO Billing.MeterBilling
		(		AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid,
				IsTimeOfDayAccount,
				IsDerived, 
				OriginalAccountNumber, 
				OriginalMeterNumber, 
				AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, 
				UploadFileSeqid,
				LastPeriodModified,
				BillingPeriod,
				BillingPeriodRevision, 
				NextBillingPeriod,
				PreviousBillingPeriod, 
				BillCreationDate, 
				BillingAction, 
				MeterBillingStatus, 
				PreviousMeterBillingStatus, 
				MeterBillingStatusCodePeriod, 
				EnergySource, 
				ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod,
				SalesType, 
				MeterType, 
				UtilityServiceAddress,
				MeterDials, 
				MeterConstant,
				Tension, 
				EstimatedReading, 
				ConsecutivePeriodsEstimatedReading,
				ProductionAndDeliveryTariff, 
				BillingPeriodDays,
				FromDate, 
				ToDate, 
				ToReadingDate,
				FromReadingDate, 
				Consumption, 
				Demand,
				InitialPostingDate, 
				AdjustmentRecordSeqid, 
				AuthenticatedUserID, 
				Notes, 
				DateAdded,
				LastUpdate
		)
		select
				AccountExchangeMeterTrackSeqid,
				IsTimeOfDayAccount,
				[DerivedFromSpannedBill],
				[OriginalAccountNumber], 
				[OriginalMeterNumber], 
				[UtilityCompanySeqid],
				[UploadMeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid],
				[LastPeriodModified],
				[BillingPeriodRevision],
				[BillingPeriodRevision],
				dbo.CreateNextPeriod(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriod, BillingCycle), -- [NextBillingPeriod] 
				dbo.CreatePreviousPeriod(Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriod, BillingCycle), -- PreviousBillingPeriod
				[BillCreationDate],
				[BillingAction],
				[MeterBillingStatus],
				[MeterBillingPreviousStatus],
				[MeterBillingStatusPeriod],
				EnergySource,
				[ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod],
				SalesType,
				MeterType,
				ServiceAddress, 
				MeterDials,
				[MeterConstant],
				null, -- Demand currently only Electric
				[EstimatedOrActualBilling],
				[Common].[CalculateConsecutiveNumberOfEstimatedReadings] (OriginalAccountNumber,OriginalMeterNumber,UtilityCompanySeqid,BillingPeriodRevision,BillingCycle,EstimatedOrActualBilling), -- correct function Gas
				Common.CalculateProductionAndDeliveryTariff(UtilityCompanySeqid,GasRateCode),
				BillingDays,
				[FromDate],
				[ToDate],
				[FromReadingDate],
				[ToReadingDate],
				[RevisedBilledTherms],
				Null, --[Demand]
				[InitialPostingDate], 
				[MeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid], 
				[AuthenticatedUserID],
				[Notes],
				[DateAdded],
				[LastUpdate]
		from	[Billing].[MeterBillingAdjustmentGas]
		where 
				MeterBillingSeqid is null  AND 
				BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod
		--
		set @BillingMeterBillingInsertTransactionCount = @@rowcount
		--
		--
		INSERT INTO Billing.MeterBillingGas
				(	
					MeterBillingSeqid, 
					MeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid, 
					UtilityCompanySeqid, 
					OriginalAccountNumber, 
					OriginalMeterNumber, 
					LastPeriodModified, 
					BillingPeriod, 
					BillingPeriodRevision, 
					MeterBillingRowState,
					FromDate, 
					ToDate, 
					FromReadingDate,
					ToReadingDate, 
					ReadingCode, 
					MeterReset,
					MeterFromReading, 
					MeterToReading, 
					MeterConstant,
					Ccf, 
					ThermsFactor, 
					Therms, 
					AuthenticatedUserID, 
					Notes, 
					DateAdded, 
					LastUpdate,
					GasCorrectionFactor
				)
		SELECT  
					MeterBillingSeqid, 
					MeterBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid, 
					UtilityCompanySeqid, 
					OriginalAccountNumber, 
					OriginalMeterNumber, 
					LastPeriodModified, 
					BillingPeriodRevision,
					BillingPeriodRevision,
					1 AS MeterBillingRowState,
					FromDate, 
					ToDate, 
					FromReadingDate, 
					ToReadingDate, 
					ReadingCode, 
					MeterReset,
					MeterFromReading,
					MeterToReading, 
					MeterConstant, 
					RevisedBilledCCF, 
					ThermsFactor,
					RevisedBilledTherms,
					AuthenticatedUserID, 
					Notes, 
					DateAdded,
					LastUpdate,
					GasCorrectionFactor
		FROM Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas
		where 
				MeterBillingSeqid is null  AND 
				BillingPeriod = @CurrentBillingPeriod
		--
		set @BillingMeterBillingGasInsertTransactionCount = @@rowcount
		--
		UPDATE    Billing.MeterBillingGas
		SET         MeterBillingSeqid = Billing.MeterBilling.MeterBillingSeqid
		FROM 
					Billing.MeterBilling INNER JOIN
					Billing.MeterBillingGas ON Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified = Billing.MeterBillingGas.LastPeriodModified AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.MeterBillingGas.UtilityCompanySeqid AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBillingGas.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.MeterBillingGas.BillingPeriod INNER JOIN
					Billing.Account ON Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBillingGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider
		WHERE (Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified = @CurrentBillingPeriod) and 
				  (Billing.Account.CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup = @InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid) and 
				  (Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider = @UtilityCompanySeqid)
					
				
		UPDATE    Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas
		SET              
					MeterBillingSeqid = Billing.MeterBillingGas.MeterBillingSeqid, 
					MeterBillingGasSeqid = Billing.MeterBillingGas.MeterBillingGasSeqid
		FROM 
					Billing.MeterBilling INNER JOIN
					Billing.MeterBillingGas ON Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified = Billing.MeterBillingGas.LastPeriodModified AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.AccountUtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.MeterBillingGas.UtilityCompanySeqid AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBillingGas.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.MeterBillingGas.BillingPeriod INNER JOIN
					Billing.Account ON Billing.MeterBillingGas.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.Account.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBillingGas.UtilityCompanySeqid = Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider INNER JOIN
					Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas ON Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalAccountNumber = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.OriginalMeterNumber = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalMeterNumber AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriod = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.BillingPeriodRevision = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision AND 
					Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified = Billing.MeterBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriod
		WHERE 
				(Billing.MeterBilling.LastPeriodModified = @CurrentBillingPeriod) AND 
				(Billing.Account.CurrentInvoiceAccountGroup = @InvoiceAccountBillingGroupSeqid) AND 
				(Billing.Account.UtilityAccountProvider = @UtilityCompanySeqid)		
		--
   END
   
   -- 2012/04/03 UM is not longer needed. All UM status will be changed to AC
   UPDATE billing.Meter
	SET MeterStatus = 'AC'
	WHERE MeterStatus = 'UM'

end
